meanings.definition: To play on a musical instrument, especially a stringed instrument, in a light and casual manner.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed tabering on her guitar in the park.
meanings.sent2: The musician was tabering on the violin at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be tabering on the piano keys with its paws.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the guitar strings, tabering a joyful tune.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her tabering filled the room with happiness.

meanings.definition: To shape or form with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was tabering the hot metal into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: He was tabering the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The chef seemed to be tabering the dough with a rolling pin.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor tabering the marble into a stunning statue.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter was tabering the wood into intricate designs.

meanings.definition: To work as a taborer or drummer.
meanings.sent1: He was tabering at the village festival, keeping the beat with his drum.
meanings.sent2: The musician was tabering with the band during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel appeared to be tabering on the tree trunk with its tiny paws.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic tabering of the drums echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The children joined in tabering with makeshift drums made of pots and pans.
